snippet: New laws further restricting abortions have been driven by the contention that fetuses can feel pain at 20 weeks after conception. The science is far less clear on the issue.
abstract: New laws further restricting abortions have been driven by contention that fetuses can feel pain at 20 weeks after conception, but science on issue is far less clear; Dr Nicholas Fisk, senior maternal-fetal medicine specialist at Royal Brisbane and Women’s Hospital in Australia, says research convinces him pain 'is not possible at all' before 24 weeks.
lead_paragraph: New laws further restricting abortions have been driven by the contention that fetuses can feel pain at 20 weeks after conception. The science is far less clear on the issue.

headline.main: Complex Science at Issue in Politics of Fetal Pain
headline.print_headline: Complex Science at Issue in Politics of Fetal Pain
